availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, day laborer and soldier. Tennessee native. Day laborer in Wayne County in 1860. Sergeant and second lieutenant in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from October 14, 1861, to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 28-29.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Etown, p. 218.
Find A Grave, "Abraham Grubb (August 17, 1837-May 22, 1914)," Memorial #52637448, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52637448 (accessed October 11, 2018).
